numbered_ace_sentences: 2. According to the graph, children from the top 0.1% of wealth in America are 7 times more likely to be admitted to an elite college than other children.
3. I wonder whether colleges target poor students by using a mode.
4. I also wonder whether this pattern is only by chance.
5. For poor students, the 30th percentile has the highest chance to be admitted to a college.
6. The chance declines before the 30th percentile.
7. The chance declines after the 30th percentile.
8. The chance increases again at the 70th percentile.
9. This situation relates to me and my community.
10. Many people in Perth Amboy have low income.
11. It is discouraging to realize this situation.
16. Elite colleges evaluate an application from a poor student differently than an application from a wealthy student.
17. The headline is: Colleges care about your money.
